benchmark_details.name: ENDIVE (English Diversity)
benchmark_details.overview: ENDIVE is a benchmark designed to evaluate five large language models across 12 natural language understanding tasks translated into five underrepresented dialects, highlighting performance disparities and promoting fairness in NLP.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark for evaluating dialectal robustness in large language models across diverse NLP tasks.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: ENDIVE's selected tasks do not cover all aspects of dialectal variation.

data.source: Derived from 12 established datasets covering various reasoning categories.
data.annotation: Human evaluation and few-shot prompting with examples from eWAVE.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on comparisons of responses to dialectal and Standard American English (SAE) inputs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance on dialectal tasks compared to SAE.
methodology.baseline_results: Established baseline comparisons against Multi-VALUE's rule-based translations.
methodology.validation: Validation through human assessments of translation quality and fluency.

harm: Perpetuation of biases against non-standard dialects
